{{Hatnote|For other people with the same name, see [[Kim Jeong-nam (disambiguation)|Kim Jeong-nam]]. Not to be confused with North Korean politician [[Kim Yong-nam]].}} {{Korean name|Kim}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2017}} {{Infobox Person |name = Kim Jong-nam |image = Kim_Jong-nam.jpg |caption = |native_name = 김정남 |native_name_lang = ko |birth_date = {{Birth date|df=yes|1971|5|10}} |birth_place = [[Pyongyang]], North Korea |death_date = {{Death date and age|df=yes|2017|2|13|1971|5|10}} |death_place = [[Sepang District]], [[Selangor]], Malaysia |body_discovered = |residence = [[Macau]], [[Singapore]], and [[Malaysia]] |ethnicity = |citizenship = |other_names = |known_for = |education = |alma_mater = [[Kim Il-sung University]] |employer = |occupation = |home_town = |title = |salary = |networth = |height = |weight = |term = |predecessor = |successor = |party = [[Workers' Party of Korea]] |boards = |religion = |spouse = Shin Jong-hui |partner = |children = 6 (including [[Kim Han-sol]]) |father = [[Kim Jong-il]] |mother = [[Song Hye-rim]] |relations = [[Kim Il-sung]] (grandfather)
[[Kim Jong-un]] (half-brother) |callsign = |signature = |website = |footnotes = |module = {{Infobox military person| embed = yes | allegiance = {{flag|North Korea|1992}} | rank = [[File:Colonel rank insignia (North Korea).svg|25px]] [[Colonel]] | branch ={{Armed forces|North Korea}} }} |death_cause = [[Assassination of Kim Jong-nam|Assassination]] |image_size = |resting_place = |resting_place_coordinates = |birth_name = }} {{Infobox Korean name|context=north | hangul={{linktext|김|정|남}} | hanja ={{linktext|金|正|男}} | rr=Gim Jeong-nam | mr=Kim Chŏng-nam|}} '''Kim Jong-nam''' ({{korean|hangul= 김정남|hanja=金正男|context=north}}, {{IPA-ko|kim.dzʌŋ.nam|lang}};{{efn|The given name ''Jong-nam'' / ''Jong Nam'' is pronounced {{IPA-ko|tsʌŋ.nam|}} in isolation.}} 10 May 1971 – 13 February 2017) was the eldest son of [[North Korea]]n leader [[Kim Jong-il]]. From roughly 1994 to 2001, he was considered the heir apparent to his father.{{cite web|url=http://www.globalo.com/kim-jong-un-big-threat-his-older-brother/ |title=Kim Jong-un's Big Threat: His Older Brother |publisher=Globalo |date=23 August 2016 |access-date=26 September 2016 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160829164752/http://www.globalo.com/kim-jong-un-big-threat-his-older-brother/ |archivedate=29 August 2016 }} He was thought to have fallen out of favour after embarrassing the regime in 2001 with a failed attempt to visit [[Tokyo Disneyland]] with a false passport, although Kim said his loss of favour was due to advocating reform. Kim was [[exile]]d from North Korea {{circa}} 2003, becoming an occasional critic of his family's regime.{{cite news|title=North Korea's leader will not last long, says Kim Jong-un's brother |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jan/17/north-korea-leader-not-long |accessdate=17 January 2012 |newspaper=The Guardian |date=17 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131223185736/http://www.theguardian.com/world/2012/jan/17/north-korea-leader-not-long |archivedate=23 December 2013 }} His younger paternal half-brother, [[Kim Jong-un]], was named heir apparent in September 2010.{{cite newspaper|publisher=[[Christian Science Monitor]] |url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Asia-Pacific/2010/1008/Kim-Jong-un-confirmed-North-Korean-heir-ahead-of-massive-military-parade |title=Kim Jong-un confirmed North Korean heir ahead of massive military parade |author=Donald Kirk |date=October 8, 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111031050924/http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Asia-Pacific/2010/1008/Kim-Jong-un-confirmed-North-Korean-heir-ahead-of-massive-military-parade |archivedate=31 October 2011 }} Kim [[Assassination of Kim Jong-nam|died on 13 February 2017]] in [[Malaysia]] as the result of what the [[US Department of State]] eventually determined was an assassination conducted by North Korea using [[VX (nerve agent)|VX]] nerve agent.{{cite web |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-malaysia-kim-usa/u-s-imposes-sanctions-on-pyongyang-over-slaying-of-north-korean-leaders-half-brother-idUSKCN1GJ031 |title=U.S. sanctions North Korea for killing of leader's half-brother |date=7 March 2018 |publisher=Reuters |accessdate=7 March 2018}} == Life and career == === Early life (1971–1998)=== Kim Jong-nam was born 10 May 1971 in [[Pyongyang]], North Korea, to [[Song Hye-rim]],{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/02/15/who-was-kim-jong-nam/ |title=Who was Kim Jong Nam? |author=Anna Fifield |date=15 February 2017 |publisher=The Washington Post |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170306033453/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2017/02/15/who-was-kim-jong-nam/ |archivedate=6 March 2017 }} one of three women known to have had children with Kim Jong-il. Because Kim Jong-il aimed to keep his affair with Song a secret due to the disapproval of his father [[Kim Il-sung]], he initially kept Jong-nam out of school, instead sending him to live with Song's older sister [[Song Hye-rang]], who tutored him at home.{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,460254-1,00.html |work=Time |title=Secret Lives |last=Lee |first=Adriana S |date=23 June 2003 |accessdate=29 October 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080408095913/http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0%2C9171%2C460254-1%2C00.html |archivedate=8 April 2008 }} North Korea Leadership Watch says he left North Korea to visit his grandmother in [[Moscow]], [[Soviet Union]], and spent his childhood at international schools in both [[Russian Soviet Federative Socialist Republic|Russia]] and [[Switzerland]] until returning to his home country in 1988.{{cite news|last1=Fifield |first1=Anna |title=N. Korean leader’s half brother killed in Malaysia in possible poison attack, police say |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/north-korean-leaders-half-brother-killed-by-poison-in-malaysia-reports-claim/2017/02/14/7324f8c6-f2af-11e6-8d72-263470bf0401_story.html |accessdate=1 March 2017 |work=Washington Post |date=15 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170302193851/https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/north-korean-leaders-half-brother-killed-by-poison-in-malaysia-reports-claim/2017/02/14/7324f8c6-f2af-11e6-8d72-263470bf0401_story.html |archivedate=2 March 2017 }} Kim was reported to have had a personality similar to that of his father, and was described by his aunt as being "hot-tempered, sensitive, and gifted in the arts".{{cite book|author=Bradley K. Martin |title=Under the Loving Care of the Fatherly Leader: North Korea and the Kim Dynasty |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=QMnf95z_x44C&pg=PA697 |date=10 January 2006 |publisher=St. Martin's Press |isbn=978-0-312-32322-6 |page=697 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170217101731/https://books.google.com/books?id=QMnf95z_x44C&pg=PA697 |archivedate=17 February 2017 }} His aunt also said in 2000 that he "[did] not wish to succeed his father". Like Kim Jong-il, he was interested in film: he wrote scripts and short films from a young age. His father also created a small [[movie set]] for him to use. Kim made several clandestine visits to Japan, starting as early as 1995. === 1998–2001: Heir apparent === In 1998, Kim was appointed to a senior position in the [[Ministry of Public Security (North Korea)|Ministry of Public Security]] of North Korea, as a future leader.{{cite news|last=Ryall |first=Julian |title=Profile: Who was Kim Jong-nam, the exiled half-brother of North Korean dictator Kim Jong-un? |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/14/profile-kim-jong-nam-exiled-half-brother-north-korean-dictator/ |accessdate=14 February 2017 |work=The Telegraph |date=14 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170214164214/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/14/profile-kim-jong-nam-exiled-half-brother-north-korean-dictator/ |archivedate=14 February 2017 }} He was also reported to have been appointed head of the North Korean Computer Committee, in charge of developing an information technology (IT) industry. In January 2001, he accompanied his father to [[Shanghai]], where he had talks with Chinese officials on the IT industry. === 2001: Tokyo Disneyland incident === In May 2001, Kim was arrested in Japan on arrival at [[Narita International Airport]], accompanied by two women and a four-year-old boy identified as his son. He was travelling on a forged [[Dominican Republic passport]] using a Chinese alias, Pang Xiong.{{cite web|url=http://www.epochtimes.com/gb/4/9/2/n648488p.htm |title={{asiantitle|金正日夫人去世使继承人问题又增悬疑|||a}} |language=Chinese |publisher=The Epoch Times |date=2 September 2004 |accessdate=28 October 2008 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090131230508/http://www.epochtimes.com/gb/4/9/2/n648488p.htm |archivedate=31 January 2009 }}{{cite web|url=http://www.atimes.com/atimes/Korea/FI02Dg01.html|title=Death of Kim's consort: Dynastic implications|author=David Scofield|publisher=Asia Times Online|date=2 September 2004|accessdate=28 October 2008}} After being detained he was deported to China,{{cite news|last1=Taylor |first1=Adam |title=The sad story of Kim Jong Chul, the North Korean leader's brother and Eric Clapton megafan |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2015/05/22/the-sad-story-of-kim-jong-chul-the-north-korean-leaders-brother-and-eric-clapton-megafan/ |accessdate=14 February 2017 |work=The Washington Post |date=22 May 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215033829/https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/worldviews/wp/2015/05/22/the-sad-story-of-kim-jong-chul-the-north-korean-leaders-brother-and-eric-clapton-megafan/ |archivedate=15 February 2017 }} where he said he was travelling to Japan to visit [[Tokyo Disney Resort|Tokyo Disneyland]]. The incident caused his father to cancel a planned visit to China due to the embarrassment it caused him. === 2001–2005: Loss of favour === Until the Tokyo incident, Kim was expected to become leader of the country after his father. In February 2003, the [[Korean People's Army]] began a propaganda campaign under the slogan "The Respected Mother is the Most Faithful and Loyal Subject to the Dear Leader Comrade Supreme Commander." This was interpreted as praise of [[Ko Yong-hui|Ko Young-hee]], such that the campaign was designed to promote [[Kim Jong-chul]] or Kim Jong-un, her sons.{{cite web|last1=Allen |first1=Dan |title=The Maybe-Gay Son of Kim Jong-Il Definitely Won't Be North Korea's Next Leader |url=https://www.queerty.com/the-maybe-gay-son-of-kim-jong-il-who-definitely-wont-be-north-koreas-next-leader-20111219 |website=Queerty |accessdate=14 February 2017 |date=19 December 2011 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215021612/https://www.queerty.com/the-maybe-gay-son-of-kim-jong-il-who-definitely-wont-be-north-koreas-next-leader-20111219 |archivedate=15 February 2017 }} Since the loyalty of the army is the real foundation of the Kim family's continuing hold on power in North Korea, this was a serious development for Kim Jong-nam's prospects. In late 2003, it was reported that Kim Jong-nam was living in [[Macau]], lending strength to this belief.{{cite web|last1=Loh |first1=Andrew |title=Kim Jong-un's half-brother takes refuge in S'pore and Malaysia |url=http://www.theonlinecitizen.com/2014/01/24/kim-jong-uns-half-brother-takes-refuge-in-spore-and-malaysia/ |work=The Global Citizen |accessdate=14 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215020640/http://www.theonlinecitizen.com/2014/01/24/kim-jong-uns-half-brother-takes-refuge-in-spore-and-malaysia/ |archivedate=15 February 2017 }} Kim Jong-un was left in charge while his father was on a state visit to China. Outsider observers also believed [[ROKS Cheonan sinking|North Korea's sinking of a South Korean ship]] in March 2010 was part of [[Kim Jong-il]]'s attempt to secure succession for the youngest Kim.{{cite news|last=Choe |first=Sang-Hun |title=Succession May Be Behind N. Korea's New Belligerence |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2010/05/28/world/asia/28north.html |work=The New York Times |date=27 May 2010 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170228170339/http://www.nytimes.com/2010/05/28/world/asia/28north.html |archivedate=28 February 2017 }} Kim's loss of favour was thought to have been caused by the Tokyo incident. Kim, however, said he fell out of favour because he had become an advocate for reform.{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-nam Says N.Korean Regime Won't Last Long |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2012/01/17/2012011701790.html |accessdate=17 January 2012 |newspaper=Chosun Ilbo (English Edition) |date=17 January 2012 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120119211617/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2012/01/17/2012011701790.html |archivedate=19 January 2012 }} In an email to the editor of the ''[[Tokyo Shimbun]]'', Kim wrote that after being educated in Switzerland, he "insisted on reform and market-opening", leading his father to decide that he had turned "into a capitalist". Kim at this time has also been described as "the closest [North Korea] ever had to an international playboy",{{cite news|last1=Kamer |first1=Nimrod |title=Kim Jong-nam was North Korea's only international playboy |url=http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/kim-jong-nam-assassinated |accessdate=2 March 2017 |work=British GQ |date=14 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170303042731/http://www.gq-magazine.co.uk/article/kim-jong-nam-assassinated |archivedate=3 March 2017 }} and gained a reputation for "gambling and drinking and arranging the occasional business deal".{{cite news|last1=Chan |first1=Kelvin |last2=Sullivan |first2=Tim |title=The strange life, and sudden death, of North Korean exile Kim Jong Nam |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2017/02/28/the-strange-life-and-sudden-death-of-north-korean-exile-kim-jong-nam.html |accessdate=2 March 2017 |work=The Toronto Star |agency=[[Associated Press]] |date=28 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170302112252/https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2017/02/28/the-strange-life-and-sudden-death-of-north-korean-exile-kim-jong-nam.html |archivedate=2 March 2017 }} He was the only member of the Kim family to ever speak directly to media outside of North Korea. It was believed that Kim Jong-nam had friendly ties to China. Outside analysts considered him as a possible candidate to replace Kim Jong-un if the North Korean leadership imploded and China, traditionally an ally, sought a replacement in its client state. === 2005–2017: Rise of Kim Jong-un === The ''[[Asahi Shimbun]]'' reported that Kim Jong-nam, while travelling to see his brother Kim Jong-chul in [[Munich]], survived an assassination attempt at the [[Budapest Ferenc Liszt International Airport|Budapest Ferihegy International Airport]] in July 2006. According to South Korean reports, the Hungarian government protested against the incident to the North Korean embassy in Vienna, requesting there be no recurrence.{{cite news|last=Yoshihiro |first=Makino |title=Was Kim Jong Nam in sights of his paranoid half-brother? |url=http://www.asahi.com/ajw/articles/AJ201702150052.html |accessdate=20 February 2017 |agency= |publisher=[[Asahi Shimbun]] |date=14 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170219213903/http://www.asahi.com/ajw/articles/AJ201702150052.html |archivedate=19 February 2017 }}{{cite news|last= |first= |title=Eric Clapton miatt járt Pesten az észak-koreai diktátor megölt testvére |url=http://www.borsonline.hu/aktualis/eric-clapton-miatt-jart-pesten-az-eszak-koreai-diktator-megolt-testvere/127205 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |language=Hungarian |publisher=Bors |date=16 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170221010445/http://www.borsonline.hu/aktualis/eric-clapton-miatt-jart-pesten-az-eszak-koreai-diktator-megolt-testvere/127205 |archivedate=21 February 2017 }} It was reported in the ''[[South China Morning Post]]'' on 1 February 2007, that Kim Jong-nam had been living incognito with his family in [[Macau]], for some three years, and that this was a cause of some embarrassment to both the Macanese and Chinese governments.{{cite news|last1=Toy |first1=Mary-Anne |title=Kim's playboy son parties in Macau |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/kims-playboy-son-parties-in-macau/2007/02/01/1169919474231.html |accessdate=14 February 2017 |work=The Sydney Morning Herald |date=2 February 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215020501/http://www.smh.com.au/news/world/kims-playboy-son-parties-in-macau/2007/02/01/1169919474231.html |archivedate=15 February 2017 }}{{cite news|last=Alfano |first=Seanc |title=Report: Kim Jong Il's Son Living In Macau |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/report-kim-jong-ils-son-living-in-macau/ |accessdate=14 February 2017 |agency=Associated Press |publisher=CBS News |date=1 February 2007 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215024651/http://www.cbsnews.com/news/report-kim-jong-ils-son-living-in-macau/ |archivedate=15 February 2017 }} South Korean television and the ''South China Morning Post'' reported in 2007 that Kim Jong-nam had a Portuguese passport. However, Portuguese authorities and the Portuguese consul in Macau, Pedro Moitinho de Almeida, stated that if Kim had such a document it would be a forgery.{{cite web|url=http://www.cmjornal.xl.pt/detalhe/noticias/ultima-hora/filho-de-kim-jong-il-com-passaporte-portugues|title=Filho de Kim Jong-il com passaporte português|language=Portuguese|publisher=CM|date=1 February 2007|accessdate=22 September 2010}} In January 2009, Kim Jong-nam said he had "no interest" in taking power in North Korea after his father, stating that it is only for his father to decide.{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-Il's eldest son has 'no interest' in leadership |url=http://www.smh.com.au/world/kim-jongils-eldest-son-has-no-interest-in-leadership-20090125-7p9v.html |accessdate=15 February 2017 |work=The Sydney Morning Herald |date=25 January 2009 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215021140/http://www.smh.com.au/world/kim-jongils-eldest-son-has-no-interest-in-leadership-20090125-7p9v.html |archivedate=15 February 2017 }} In June 2010, Kim Jong-nam gave a brief interview to the [[Associated Press]] in Macau while waiting for a hotel elevator.{{cite news|url=http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/nationworld/2012048945_apasskoreashipsinks.html |title=NKorean leader's son gives interview |author1=William Foreman |author2=Hyung Jin-kim |agency=Associated Press |publisher=The Seattle Times |date=6 June 2010 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110622074319/http://seattletimes.nwsource.com/html/nationworld/2012048945_apasskoreashipsinks.html |archivedate=22 June 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }} He said that he had "no plans" to defect to Europe, as the press had recently rumoured. Kim Jong-nam lived in an apartment on the southern tip of Macau's [[Coloane Island]] until 2007. An anonymous South Korean official reported in October 2010 that Kim Jong-nam had not lived in Macau for "months", and shuttled between China and "another country". In late September 2010, his younger half-brother [[Kim Jong-un]] was made heir-apparent.{{cite web|url=http://www.rthk.org.hk/rthk/news/englishnews/news.htm?main&20090718&56&597742 |title=Kim Jong-il's grandson seen at concert |publisher=RTHK |date=18 July 2009 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110605113049/http://www.rthk.org.hk/rthk/news/englishnews/news.htm?main&20090718&56&597742 |archivedate= 5 June 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}{{cite web|url=https://mobile.nytimes.com/2010/10/01/world/asia/01korea.html |title=North Korea Releases First Photo of Kim’s Heir |author=Mark McDonald |publisher=The New York Times |date=30 September 2010 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170221011844/https://mobile.nytimes.com/2010/10/01/world/asia/01korea.html |archivedate=21 February 2017 }} Kim Jong-un was declared Supreme Leader of North Korea on 24 December 2011 after the death of Kim Jong-il. The two half-brothers had never met, because of the ancient practice of raising potential successors separately.{{cite news|title=Kim Jong-nam received 'direct warning' from North Korea after criticising regime of half-brother Kim Jong-un |first=Danielle |last=Demetriou |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/17/kim-jong-nam-warned-pyongyang-criticising-regime-japanese-journalist/ |newspaper=The Telegraph |location=United Kingdom |date=17 February 2017 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |page= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170218001124/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/02/17/kim-jong-nam-warned-pyongyang-criticising-regime-japanese-journalist/ |archivedate=18 February 2017 |deadurl=no |df= }}{{cite news|title=North Korea's ruling family: Who is Kim Jong Nam? |first=Euan |last=McKirdy |url=http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/16/asia/kim-jong-nam-profile/ |newspaper=CNN |location=U.S. |date=16 February 2017 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |page= |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170216093813/http://www.cnn.com/2017/02/16/asia/kim-jong-nam-profile/ |archivedate=16 February 2017 |deadurl=no |df= }} On 1 January 2012, it was reported that Kim Jong-nam secretly flew to Pyongyang from Macau on 17 December 2011, after learning about his father's death that day and was presumed to have accompanied Kim Jong-un when paying his last respects to their father. He left after a few days to return to Macau and was not in attendance at the funeral to avoid speculation about the succession.{{cite web|url=http://www.news.com.au/world/kims-eldest-in-secret-visit-to-see-body/story-e6frfkyi-1226234297219 |title=Kim's eldest in 'secret visit' to see body |work=Agence France-Presse |date=1 January 2012 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120102075057/http://www.news.com.au/world/kims-eldest-in-secret-visit-to-see-body/story-e6frfkyi-1226234297219 |archivedate= 2 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |df= }} On 14 January 2012, Kim Jong-nam was seen in Beijing waiting for an [[Air China]] flight to Macau. Kim confirmed his identity to a group of South Koreans which included a professor at [[Incheon University]], and told them he usually travels alone.{{cite web|url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2012/01/16/2012011601009.html |title=Kim Jong-nam Resurfaces in Beijing |work=The Chosun Ilbo |date=16 January 2012 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170301121137/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2012/01/16/2012011601009.html |archivedate=1 March 2017 }} In a book released in 2012 titled ''My Father, Kim Jong Il, and Me'' by Japanese journalist [[Yōji Gomi]] who had interviewed Kim Jong-nam on numerous occasions, Kim Jong-nam said he expected the leadership of Kim Jong-un to fail, citing that he was too inexperienced and young. He also stated, "Without reforms, North Korea will collapse, and when such changes take place, the regime will collapse".{{cite web|url=http://edition.cnn.com/2012/01/17/world/asia/north-korea-kim-other-son/index.html |title=Kim Jong Il's other son expects North Korean regime to fail, journalist says |author=Kyung Lah |publisher=CNN |date=17 January 2012 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170227232053/http://edition.cnn.com/2012/01/17/world/asia/north-korea-kim-other-son/index.html |archivedate=27 February 2017 }} According to South Korean intelligence sources, Kim Jong-un had issued a standing order to have his half-brother killed. In 2012, there was another assassination attempt on Kim Jong-nam, who later that year sent a letter to his half-brother begging for his life. In late 2012, he appeared in [[Singapore]] one year after leaving Macau.{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9680540/Kim-Jong-ils-son-reappears-in-Singapore.html |title=Kim Jong-il's son reappears in Singapore |first=Julian |last=Ryall |work=The Telegraph |date=15 November 2012 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170215114500/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/northkorea/9680540/Kim-Jong-ils-son-reappears-in-Singapore.html |archivedate=15 February 2017 }} He left Macau on suspicions that he was being targeted for assassination by Kim Jong-un; South Korean authorities had formerly indicted a North Korean agent, Kim Yong-su, who confessed to planning an attack on Kim Jong-nam in July 2010.{{cite web|url=http://shanghaiist.com/2012/11/16/kim_jong-ils_son_reappears_in_singa.php |title=Kim Jong-il's son reappears in Singapore one year after fleeing Macau |first=James |last=Griffiths |publisher=Shanghaiist |date=16 November 2012 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141226020506/http://shanghaiist.com/2012/11/16/kim_jong-ils_son_reappears_in_singa.php |archivedate=26 December 2014 }} == Personal life == It has been reported that Kim had [[polygamy|two wives]], at least one [[Mistress (lover)|mistress]],[http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/10/04/2010100401059.html Where Is Kim Jong-il's Eldest Son?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101006202317/http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2010/10/04/2010100401059.html |date=6 October 2010 }}. ''The Chosun Ilbo''. 4 October 2010. and had at least six children.{{cite web|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-02-16/kim-jong-nam-pleaded-for-his-life/8276112 |title=Kim Jong-nam killed after pleading with his brother to spare his life |publisher=ABC |date=16 February 2017 |accessdate=20 February 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170220092638/http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-02-16/kim-jong-nam-pleaded-for-his-life/8276112 |archivedate=20 February 2017 }} His first wife, Shin Jong-hui (born {{circa|1980}}), lives at a home called Dragon Villa on the northern outskirts of Beijing. His second wife, Lee Hye-kyong (born {{circa|1970}}), their son [[Kim Han-sol|Han-sol]] (born 1995) and their daughter Sol-hui (born {{circa|1998}}) lived in a modest 12-story [[apartment building]] in Macau; Jong-nam's mistress, former [[Air Koryo]] [[flight attendant]] So Yong-la (born {{circa|1980}}), also lives in Macau. He had several tattoos, including two of [[dragon]]s.{{cite news |url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2017/10/04/asia-pacific/kim-jong-nam-may-poisoned-suspects-trial-told/ |quote=A post-mortem report submitted to the trial Tuesday revealed new personal details about Kim, such as that he had several tattoos, including one of a dragon and another of a dragon’s head breathing fire. |title=Kim Jong Nam may have been poisoned by other suspects, trial told |publisher=''[[The Japan Times]]'' |date=October 4, 2017 |access-date=October 4, 2017}} {{Kim dynasty (North Korea) family tree}} == [[Image:Ground glass hepatocytes high mag cropped.jpg|thumb|right|upright=1.4|[[Micrograph]] showing lipofuscin, in brown/yellow, in a [[liver]] [[biopsy]] with [[ground glass hepatocytes]]; [[H&E stain]]]] '''Lipofuscin''' is the name given to fine yellow-brown [[pigment]] [[Granule (cell biology)|granules]] composed of [[lipid]]-containing residues of [[Lysosome|lysosomal]] digestion.<ref name="Dorland's">{{cite book|last1=Alberts|first1=Daniel Albert|title=Dorland's illustrated medical dictionary.|date=2012|publisher=Saunders/Elsevier|location=Philadelphia, PA|isbn=978-1-4160-6257-8|page=1062|edition=32nd}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Medical Definition of LIPOFUSCIN|url=https://www.merriam-webster.com/medical/lipofuscin|website=www.merriam-webster.com|language=en}}</ref> It is considered to be one of the aging or "wear-and-tear" pigments, found in the [[liver]], [[kidney]], [[heart]] muscle, retina, [[adrenal]]s, [[nerve]] cells, and [[ganglion]] cells.<ref>Young B, Lowe JS, Stevens A, Heath JW. Wheater's Functional Histology: A Text and Atlas. 6th ed. Elsevier</ref> It is specifically arranged around the nucleus, and is a type of [[lipochrome]].
==Formation and turnover== It appears to be the product of the [[oxidation]] of [[unsaturated fatty acid]]s and may be symptomatic of membrane damage, or damage to [[mitochondria]] and [[lysosome]]s. Aside from a large lipid content, lipofuscin is known to contain sugars and metals, including [[mercury (element)|mercury]], [[aluminum]], [[iron]], [[copper]] and [[zinc]].<ref name=gaugler>Chris Gaugler, "[http://wwwchem.csustan.edu/chem4400/SJBR/lipofus.htm Lipofuscin] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070715160509/http://wwwchem.csustan.edu/chem4400/SJBR/lipofus.htm |date=2007-07-15 }}", ''Stanislaus Journal of Biochemical Reviews'' May 1997</ref> Lipofuscin is also accepted as consisting of oxidized proteins (30–70%) as well as lipids (20–50%).<ref name="Double">{{cite journal |last1=Double |first1=KL |last2=Dedov |first2=VN |last3=Fedorow |first3=H |last4=Kettle |first4=E |last5=Halliday |first5=GM |last6=Garner |first6=B |last7=Brunk |first7=UT |title=The comparative biology of neuromelanin and lipofuscin in the human brain. |journal=Cellular and molecular life sciences : CMLS |date=June 2008 |volume=65 |issue=11 |pages=1669-82 |doi=10.1007/s00018-008-7581-9 |pmid=18278576}}</ref>
The accumulation of lipofuscin-like material may be the result of an imbalance between formation and disposal mechanisms: Such accumulation can be induced in rats by administering a [[protease]] inhibitor ([[leupeptin]]); after a period of three months, the levels of the lipofuscin-like material return to normal, indicating the action of a significant disposal mechanism.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Katz | first1 = ML | last2 = Rice | first2 = LM | last3 = Gao | first3 = CL | year = 1999 | title = Reversible accumulation of lipofuscin-like inclusions in the retinal pigment epithelium | url = http://www.iovs.org/cgi/content/abstract/40/1/175 | journal = Investigative Ophthalmology & Visual Science | volume = 40 | issue = | pages = 175–181 }}</ref> However, this result is controversial, as it is questionable if the [[leupeptin]]-induced material is true lipofuscin.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Terman | first1 = Alexei | last2 = Brunk | first2 = Ulf T. | year = 1999 | title = Is Lipofuscin Eliminated from Cells? | url = http://www.iovs.org/cgi/content/full/40/10/2463 | journal = Investigative Ophthalmology and Visual Science | volume = 40 | issue = | pages = 2463–2464 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Davies | first1 = Sallyanne | last2 = Ellis | first2 = Steven | year = 1999 | title = Lipofuscin Turnover | url = http://www.iovs.org/cgi/content/full/40/8/1887 | journal = Investigative Ophthalmology and Visual Science | volume = 40 | issue = | pages = 1887–1888 }}</ref> There exists evidence that "true lipofuscin" is not degradable ''in vitro'';<ref>{{cite journal|author=Terman, A, Brunk, UT |year=1998|title=On the degradability and exocytosis of ceroid/lipofuscin in cultured rat cardiac myocytes |journal=Mech Ageing Dev|volume=100 |pages=145–156 | pmid= 9541135|doi=10.1016/S0047-6374(97)00129-2|issue=2}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Terman | first1 = A | last2 = Brunk | first2 = UT | year = 1998 | title = Ceroid/lipofuscin formation in cultured human fibroblasts: the role of oxidative stress and lysosomal proteolysis | url = | journal = Mech Ageing Dev | volume = 104 | issue = | pages = 277–291 | pmid = 9818731 | doi=10.1016/s0047-6374(98)00073-6}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Elleder | first1 = M | last2 = Drahota | first2 = Z | last3 = Lisá | first3 = V | last4 = Mares | first4 = V | last5 = Mandys | first5 = V | last6 = Müller | first6 = J | last7 = Palmer | first7 = DN | year = 1995 | title = Tissue culture loading test with storage granules from animal models of neuronal ceroid-lipofuscinosis (Batten disease): testing their lysosomal degradability by normal and Batten cells | url = | journal = Am J Med Genet | volume = 57 | issue = | pages = 213–221 | doi = 10.1002/ajmg.1320570220 | pmid = 7668332 }}</ref> whether this holds ''in vivo'' over longer time periods is not clear.
[[Image:A2E.svg|380px|right|thumb|'''''N''-retinylidene-''N''-retinyl-ethanolamine''' ('''''A2E''''', a lipofuscin example)]]
The ''ABCR -/-'' knockout mouse has delayed dark adaptation but normal final rod threshold relative to controls.<ref name="weng1999">{{cite journal | vauthors = Weng J, Mata NL, Azarian SM, Tzekov RT, Birch DG, Travis GH | title = Insights into the function of Rim protein in photoreceptors and etiology of Stargardt's disease from the phenotype in abcr knockout mice | journal = Cell | volume = 98 | issue = 1 | pages = 13–23 | date = July 1999 | pmid = 10412977 | doi = 10.1016/S0092-8674(00)80602-9 }}</ref> Bleaching the retina with strong light leads to formation of toxic cationic ''bis''-pyridinium salt, '''''N''-retinylidene-''N''-retinyl-ethanolamine''' ('''''A2E'''''), which causes dry and wet [[age-related macular degeneration]].<ref name="maeda2008">{{cite journal | vauthors = Maeda A, Maeda T, Golczak M, Palczewski K | title = Retinopathy in mice induced by disrupted all-trans-retinal clearance | journal = The Journal of Biological Chemistry | volume = 283 | issue = 39 | pages = 26684–93 | date = September 2008 | pmid = 18658157 | pmc = 2546559 | doi = 10.1074/jbc.M804505200 }}</ref> From this experiment, it was concluded that ABCR has a significant role in preventing formation of A2E in extracellular photoreceptor surfaces during bleach recovery.
==Relation to diseases== [[File:Cardiac myocyte showing lipofuscin pigment.jpg|thumbnail|[[Micrograph]] of heart muscle showing lipofuscin pigment, [[H&E stain]]]] Lipofuscin accumulation is a major risk factor implicated in [[macular degeneration]], a degenerative disease of the eye,<ref>John Lacey, "[http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2006-05/hms-hms052306.php Harvard Medical signs agreement with Merck to develop potential therapy for macular degeneration]", 23-May-2006</ref> as well as [[Stargardt disease]], an inherited juvenile form of macular degeneration.
Abnormal accumulation of lipofuscin known as ''lipofuscinosis''<ref name="Dorland's"/> is associated with a family of [[neurodegenerative disorder]]s – [[neuronal ceroid lipofuscinosis|neuronal ceroid lipofuscinoses]], the most common of these is [[Batten disease]].
Pathological accumulation of lipofuscin is implicated in [[Alzheimer's disease]], [[Parkinson's disease]], [[amyotrophic lateral sclerosis]], certain [[lysosomal disease]]s, [[acromegaly]], denervation [[atrophy]], [[lipid]] [[myopathy]], [[chronic obstructive pulmonary disease]],<ref>{{cite journal |author1=Joakim Allaire |author2=François Maltais |author3=Pierre LeBlanc |author4=Pierre-Michel Simard |author5=François Whittom |author6=Jean-François Doyon |author7=Clermont Simard |author8=Jean Jobin |year=2002 |title=Lipofuscin accumulation in the vastus lateralis muscle in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease |journal=[[Muscle and Nerve]] |volume=25 |issue=3 |pages=383–389 |doi=10.1002/mus.10039}}</ref> and [[centronuclear myopathy]]. Accumulation of lipofuscin in the colon is the cause of the condition [[melanosis coli]].
==Possible therapies== [[Calorie restricted diet|Calorie restriction]],<ref name=gaugler /> [[vitamin E]],<ref name=gaugler /> and increased [[glutathione]] appear to reduce or halt the production of lipofuscin.
The [[nootropic drug]] [[piracetam]] appears to significantly reduce accumulation of lipofuscin in the brain tissue of rats.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Paula-Barbosa | first1 = M. | display-authors = etal | year = 1991 | title = The effects of Piracetam on lipofuscin of the rat cerebellar and hippocampa; neurons after long-term alcohol treatment and withdrawal | journal = Alcoholism: Clinical and Experimental Research | volume = 15 | issue = | pages = 834–838 | doi=10.1111/j.1530-0277.1991.tb00610.x}}</ref>
Other possible treatments: *[[Centrophenoxine]]<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Roy | first1 = D | last2 = Pathak | first2 = DN | last3 = Singh | first3 = R | year = 1983 | title = Effect of centrophenoxine on the antioxidative enzymes in various regions of the aging rat brain. | pmid = 6416880| journal = Exp Gerontol | volume = 18 | issue = 3| pages = 185–97 | doi=10.1016/0531-5565(83)90031-1}}</ref> *[[Acetyl-L-carnitine]]<ref>Amenta F, Ferrante F, ''et al.'', [http://pubmed.gov/2589915 Reduced lipofuscin accumulation in senescent rat brain by long-term acetyl-L-carnitine treatment.] ''Arch Gerontol Geriatr.'' 1989 Sep-Oct;9(2):147-53.</ref> *''[[Ginkgo biloba]]''<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Huang | first1 = SZ | last2 = Luo | first2 = YJ | last3 = Wang | first3 = L | last4 = Cai | first4 = KY | date = Jan 2005 | title = Effect of ginkgo biloba extract on livers in aged rats. | pmid = 15609412| journal = World J Gastroenterol | volume = 11 | issue = 1| pages = 132–5 | doi=10.3748/wjg.v11.i1.132 | pmc=4205372}}</ref> *[[Dimethylethanolamine]] {{Citation needed|date=December 2017}}
Wet [[macular degeneration]] can be treated using selective [[photothermolysis]] where a pulsed unfocused [[laser]] predominantly heats and kills lipofuscin-rich cells, leaving untouched healthy cells to multiply and fill in the gaps.{{citation needed|date=December 2010}} The technique is also used as a skin treatment to remove [[Tattoo removal|tattoos]], [[liverspots]], and in general make skin appear younger. This ability to selectively target lipofuscin has opened up research opportunities in the field of [[anti-aging medicine]].
A tetrahydropyridoether can remove lipofuscin from retinal pigment epithelial cells.<ref>{{cite journal | last1 = Julien | first1 = S | last2 = Schraermeyer | first2 = U | date = Oct 2012 | title = Lipofuscin can be removed from the retinal pigment epithelium of monkeys | url = | journal = Neurobiol Aging | volume = 33 | issue = 10| pages = 2390–7 | doi = 10.1016/j.neurobiolaging.2011.12.009 }}</ref> This opens up a new therapy option for the treatment of dry age-related macular degeneration and Stargardt disease, for which there is currently no treatment. The drug has now been granted [http://www.ema.europa.eu/ema/index.jsp?curl=pages/medicines/human/orphans/2013/12/human_orphan_001287.jsp&mid=WC0b01ac058001d12b orphan drug designation for the treatment of Stargardt disease] by the European Medicines Agency.
==Other uses== Lipofuscin quantification is used for age determination in various [[crustacean]]s such as [[lobster]]s and [[spiny lobster]]s.<ref>{{cite journal |author1=Ingebrigt Uglem, Mark Belchier |author2=Terje Svåsand |lastauthoramp=yes|year=2005 |title=Age determination of European lobsters (''Homarus gammarus'' L.) by histological quantification of lipofuscin |journal=[[Journal of Crustacean Biology]] |volume=25 |issue=1 |pages=95–99 |jstor=1549930 |doi=10.1651/c-2448}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |author1=Kerry E. Maxwell |author2=Thomas R. Matthews |author3=Matt R. J. Sheehy |author4=Rodney D. Bertelsen |author5=Charles D. Derby |year= 2007|title=Neurolipofuscin is a measure of age in ''Panulirus argus'', the Caribbean spiny lobster, in Florida |journal=[[The Biological Bulletin]] |volume=213 |issue=1 |pages=55–66 |url=http://www.biolbull.org/content/213/1/55.full |jstor=25066618}}</ref> Since these animals lack bony parts, they cannot be aged in the same way as bony fish, in which annual increments in the ear-bones or otoliths are commonly used. Age determination of fish and shellfish is a fundamental step in generating basic biological data such as growth curves, and is needed for many stock assessment methods. Several studies have indicated that quantifying the amount of lipofuscin present in the eye-stalks of various crustaceans can give an index of their age. This method has not yet been widely applied in fisheries management mainly due to problems in relating lipofuscin levels in wild-caught animals with accumulation curves derived from aquarium-reared animals.
